Description: Corroded copper alloy blade of a chisel made of a thin plate of metal of a narrow parabolic shape on one side and with a slightly convex cutting edge on the other.
Curator's comments: One of the bronze "chisels" of "various shapes" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 77 § 76, pl. xxxix, 24
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 77 § 76, pl. xxxix, 24)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.75, p.184, pl.26)
